fas_02_a.Description: Has the patient had a period or periods today when he/she seemed to be confused and muddled and then a period or periods when he/she seemed to be improved and functioning better?

fas_02_b.Description: If yes, how much of the day was he/she confused?

fas_02_c.Description: (If yes) How great was the difference today between the worst period of function and the best period of function?

Levels.2: A moderate degree of variation which had a clear effect on his/her ability to function at the same level throughout the day
Levels.3: A marked degree of variation which had a large effect on his/her ability to function at the same level throughout the day

fas_02_worst.LongName: FAS Q02: Example of worst function
fas_02_worst.Description: (If yes) Describe example of worst period of function

fas_02_best.LongName: FAS Q02: Example of best function
fas_02_best.Description: (If yes) Describe example of best period of function

fas_03_a.Description: Has the patient been excessively drowsy today?

fas_03_b.Description: If yes, how much of the day was he/she sleeping?

fas_03_c.Description: Were there any periods when he/she was unarousable (blackouts) today?

fas_04.Description: Did the patient have difficulty focusing attention for example, was he/she easily distractible, or did he/ she have difficulty keeping track of what was being said) throughout the day

fas_05.Description: Was the patient`s thinking disorganised or incoherent, for example, with rambling or irrelevant conversation, unclear or illogical flow of ideas, or unpredictable switching from subject to subject) throughout the day?

fas_06.LongName: FAS Q06: Altered level of consciousness
fas_06.Description: Overall, how would you rate this patient`s level of consciousness today?

fas_07_a.Description: How well does the patient understand what you communicate to him/her (you may use speaking, writing or gesturing)?

Levels.1: Understands some of what you communicate
Levels.2: Understands almost nothing of what you communicate

fas_07_b.Description: How well does the patient communicate (using speaking, writing or gesturing)?

Levels.0: Well enough to make him/herself easily understood at all times throughout the day
Levels.1: Can be understood sometimes or with some difficulty
Levels.2: Can rarely or never be understood for whatever reason

fas_score_total.Description: Sum of sub-components. Note where applicable No = 0, Yes = 1 (i.e. when scoring 1a, 1b, 2a, 3a, 3c, 4, 5)
